welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content: ## About An implementation of the Discord Voice API for Node.js, written in TypeScript. **Features:** - Send and receive* audio in Discord voice-based channels - A strong focus on reliability and predictable behaviour - Horizontal scalability and libraries other than [discord.js](https://discord.js.org/) are supported with custom adapters - A robust audio processing system that can handle a wide range of audio sources \**Audio receive is not documented by Discord so stable support is not guaranteed* ## Installation **Node.js 16.0.0 or newer is required.** ```sh-session npm install @discordjs/voice yarn add @discordjs/voice pnpm add @discordjs/voice ``` ## Dependencies This library has several optional dependencies to support a variety of different platforms. Install one dependency from each of the categories shown below. The dependencies are listed in order of preference for performance. If you can't install one of the options, try installing another. **Encryption Libraries (npm install):** - `sodium`: ^3.0.2 - `tweetnacl`: ^1.0.3 - `libsodium-wrappers`: ^0.7.9 **Opus Libraries (npm install):** - `@discordjs/opus`: ^0.4.0 - `opusscript`: ^0.0.7 **FFmpeg:** - [`FFmpeg`](https://ffmpeg.org/) (installed and added to environment) - `ffmpeg-static`: ^4.2.7 (npm install) ## Links - [Website](https://discord.js.org/) ([source](https://github.com/discordjs/website)) - [Documentation](https://discord.js.org/#/docs/voice) - [Examples](https://github.com/discordjs/voice/tree/main/examples) - [discord.js Discord server](https://discord.gg/djs) - [GitHub](https://github.com/discordjs/voice) - [NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@discordjs/voice) ## Contributing Before creating an issue, please ensure that it hasn't already been reported/suggested, and double-check the [documentation](https://discord.js.org/#/docs/voice). See [the contribution guide](https://github.com/discordjs/voice/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) if you'd like to submit a PR. ## Help If you don't understand something in the documentation, you are experiencing problems, or you just need a gentle nudge in the right direction, please don't hesitate to join our official [discord.js Server](https://discord.gg/djs).

classes.name: AudioPlayer
classes.description: Used to play audio resources (i.e. tracks, streams) to voice connections.

props.name: _state
props.description: The state that the AudioPlayer is in.

props.name: behaviors
props.description: The behavior that the player should follow when it enters certain situations.

props.name: debug
props.description: The debug logger function, if debugging is enabled.

props.name: subscribers
props.description:
A list of VoiceConnections that are registered to this AudioPlayer. The player will attempt to play audio
to the streams in this list.

props.name: playable
props.description: A list of subscribed voice connections that can currently receive audio to play.

props.name: state
props.description: The state that the player is in.

methods.name: _preparePacket
methods.description:
Instructs the given connections to each prepare this packet to be played at the start of the
next cycle.

params.name: packet
params.description: The Opus packet to be prepared by each receiver

params.name: receivers
params.description: The connections that should play this packet

methods.name: _signalStopSpeaking
methods.description:
Signals to all the subscribed connections that they should send a packet to Discord indicating
they are no longer speaking. Called once playback of a resource ends.

methods.name: _stepDispatch
methods.description:
Called roughly every 20ms by the global audio player timer. Dispatches any audio packets that are buffered
by the active connections of this audio player.

methods.name: _stepPrepare
methods.description:
Called roughly every 20ms by the global audio player timer. Attempts to read an audio packet from the
underlying resource of the stream, and then has all the active connections of the audio player prepare it
(encrypt it, append header data) so that it is ready to play at the start of the next cycle.

methods.name: checkPlayable
methods.description: Checks whether the underlying resource (if any) is playable (readable)
methods.returnsDescription: `true` if the resource is playable, otherwise `false`

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Pauses playback of the current resource, if any.

params.name: interpolateSilence
params.description: If true, the player will play 5 packets of silence after pausing to prevent audio glitches

methods.returnsDescription: `true` if the player was successfully paused, otherwise `false`

methods.name: play
methods.description:
Plays a new resource on the player. If the player is already playing a resource, the existing resource is destroyed
(it cannot be reused, even in another player) and is replaced with the new resource.

methods.name: stop
methods.description:
Stops playback of the current resource and destroys the resource. The player will either transition to the Idle state,
or remain in its current state until the silence padding frames of the resource have been played.

params.name: force
params.description: If true, will force the player to enter the Idle state even if the resource has silence padding frames

methods.returnsDescription: `true` if the player will come to a stop, otherwise `false`

methods.name: subscribe
methods.description:
Subscribes a VoiceConnection to the audio player's play list. If the VoiceConnection is already subscribed,
then the existing subscription is used.
methods.returnsDescription: The new subscription if the voice connection is not yet subscribed, otherwise the existing subscription

methods.name: unpause
methods.description: Unpauses playback of the current resource, if any.
methods.returnsDescription: `true` if the player was successfully unpaused, otherwise `false`

methods.name: unsubscribe
methods.description: Unsubscribes a subscription - i.e. removes a voice connection from the play list of the audio player.
methods.returnsDescription: Whether or not the subscription existed on the player and was removed

classes.name: AudioPlayerError
classes.description:
An error emitted by an AudioPlayer. Contains an attached resource to aid with
debugging and identifying where the error came from.

props.name: resource
props.description: The resource associated with the audio player at the time the error was thrown.

methods.name: captureStackTrace
methods.description: Create .stack property on a target object

classes.name: AudioReceiveStream
classes.description:
A readable stream of Opus packets received from a specific entity
in a Discord voice connection.

props.name: destroyed
props.description: Is `true` after `readable.destroy()` has been called.

props.name: end
props.description: The end behavior of the receive stream.

props.name: readable
props.description:
Is `true` if it is safe to call `readable.read()`, which means
the stream has not been destroyed or emitted `'error'` or `'end'`.

props.name: readableAborted
props.description: Returns whether the stream was destroyed or errored before emitting `'end'`.

props.name: readableDidRead
props.description: Returns whether `'data'` has been emitted.

props.name: readableEncoding
props.description: Getter for the property `encoding` of a given `Readable` stream. The `encoding`property can be set using the `readable.setEncoding()` method.

props.name: readableEnded
props.description: Becomes `true` when `'end'` event is emitted.

props.name: readableFlowing
props.description:
This property reflects the current state of a `Readable` stream as described
in the `Three states` section.

props.name: readableHighWaterMark
props.description: Returns the value of `highWaterMark` passed when creating this `Readable`.

props.name: readableLength
props.description:
This property contains the number of bytes (or objects) in the queue
ready to be read. The value provides introspection data regarding
the status of the `highWaterMark`.

props.name: readableObjectMode
props.description: Getter for the property `objectMode` of a given `Readable` stream.

props.name: captureRejections
props.description: Sets or gets the default captureRejection value for all emitters.

props.name: errorMonitor
props.description:
This symbol shall be used to install a listener for only monitoring `'error'`
events. Listeners installed using this symbol are called before the regular
`'error'` listeners are called.

methods.name: addListener
methods.description:
Event emitter
The defined events on documents including:
1. close
2. data
3. end
4. error
5. pause
6. readable
7. resume

methods.name: destroy
methods.description:
Destroy the stream. Optionally emit an `'error'` event, and emit a `'close'`event (unless `emitClose` is set to `false`). After this call, the readable
stream will release any internal resources and subsequent calls to `push()`will be ignored.

params.name: error
params.description: Error which will be passed as payload in `'error'` event

methods.name: eventNames
methods.description:
Returns an array listing the events for which the emitter has registered
listeners. The values in the array are strings or `Symbol`s.

methods.name: getMaxListeners
methods.description:
Returns the current max listener value for the `EventEmitter` which is either
set by `emitter.setMaxListeners(n)` or defaults to {@link defaultMaxListeners}.

methods.name: isPaused
methods.description:
The `readable.isPaused()` method returns the current operating state of the`Readable`. This is used primarily by the mechanism that underlies the`readable.pipe()` method. In most
typical cases, there will be no reason to
use this method directly.

methods.name: listenerCount
methods.description: Returns the number of listeners listening to the event named `eventName`.

params.name: eventName
params.description: The name of the event being listened for

methods.name: listeners
methods.description: Returns a copy of the array of listeners for the event named `eventName`.

methods.name: off
methods.description: Alias for `emitter.removeListener()`.

methods.name: pause
methods.description:
The `readable.pause()` method will cause a stream in flowing mode to stop
emitting `'data'` events, switching out of flowing mode. Any data that
becomes available will remain in the internal buffer.

methods.name: rawListeners
methods.description:
Returns a copy of the array of listeners for the event named `eventName`,
including any wrappers (such as those created by `.once()`).

methods.name: read
methods.description:
The `readable.read()` method pulls some data out of the internal buffer and
returns it. If no data available to be read, `null` is returned. By default,
the data will be returned as a `Buffer` object unless an encoding has been
specified using the `readable.setEncoding()` method or the stream is operating
in object mode.

params.name: size
params.description: Optional argument to specify how much data to read.

methods.name: removeAllListeners
methods.description: Removes all listeners, or those of the specified `eventName`.

methods.name: resume
methods.description:
The `readable.resume()` method causes an explicitly paused `Readable` stream to
resume emitting `'data'` events, switching the stream into flowing mode.

methods.name: setEncoding
methods.description:
The `readable.setEncoding()` method sets the character encoding for
data read from the `Readable` stream.

methods.name: setMaxListeners
methods.description:
By default `EventEmitter`s will print a warning if more than `10` listeners are
added for a particular event. This is a useful default that helps finding
memory leaks. The `emitter.setMaxListeners()` method allows the limit to be
modified for this specific `EventEmitter` instance. The value can be set to`Infinity` (or `0`) to indicate an unlimited number of listeners.

methods.name: unpipe
methods.description:
The `readable.unpipe()` method detaches a `Writable` stream previously attached
using the {@link pipe} method.

methods.name: unshift
methods.description:
Passing `chunk` as `null` signals the end of the stream (EOF) and behaves the
same as `readable.push(null)`, after which no more data can be written. The EOF
signal is put at the end of the buffer and any buffered data will still be
flushed.

params.name: chunk
params.description:
Chunk of data to unshift onto the read queue. For streams not operating in object mode, `chunk` must be a string, `Buffer`, `Uint8Array` or `null`. For object mode
streams, `chunk` may be any JavaScript value.

params.name: encoding
params.description: Encoding of string chunks. Must be a valid `Buffer` encoding, such as `'utf8'` or `'ascii'`.

methods.name: wrap
methods.description:
Prior to Node.js 0.10, streams did not implement the entire `stream` module API
as it is currently defined. (See `Compatibility` for more information.)

methods.name: from
methods.description: A utility method for creating Readable Streams out of iterators.

methods.name: getEventListeners
methods.description: Returns a copy of the array of listeners for the event named `eventName`.

methods.name: isDisturbed
methods.description: Returns whether the stream has been read from or cancelled.

methods.name: listenerCount
methods.description: A class method that returns the number of listeners for the given `eventName`registered on the given `emitter`.

methods.name: on
methods.description:
```js
const { on, EventEmitter } = require('events');

params.name: eventName
params.description: The name of the event being listened for

methods.returnsDescription: that iterates `eventName` events emitted by the `emitter`

methods.name: once
methods.description:
Creates a `Promise` that is fulfilled when the `EventEmitter` emits the given
event or that is rejected if the `EventEmitter` emits `'error'` while waiting.
The `Promise` will resolve with an array of all the arguments emitted to the
given event.

classes.name: AudioResource
classes.description: Represents an audio resource that can be played by an audio player.

props.name: audioPlayer
props.description: The audio player that the resource is subscribed to, if any.

props.name: edges
props.description:
The pipeline used to convert the input stream into a playable format. For example, this may
contain an FFmpeg component for arbitrary inputs, and it may contain a VolumeTransformer component
for resources with inline volume transformation enabled.

props.name: encoder
props.description:
If using an Opus encoder to create this audio resource, then this will be a prism-media opus.Encoder.
You can use this to control settings such as bitrate, FEC, PLP.

props.name: metadata
props.description: Optional metadata that can be used to identify the resource.

props.name: playStream
props.description: An object-mode Readable stream that emits Opus packets. This is what is played by audio players.

props.name: playbackDuration
props.description: The playback duration of this audio resource, given in milliseconds.

props.name: silencePaddingFrames
props.description: The number of silence frames to append to the end of the resource's audio stream, to prevent interpolation glitches.

props.name: silenceRemaining
props.description: The number of remaining silence frames to play. If -1, the frames have not yet started playing.

props.name: started
props.description: Whether or not the stream for this resource has started (data has become readable)

props.name: volume
props.description:
If the resource was created with inline volume transformation enabled, then this will be a
prism-media VolumeTransformer. You can use this to alter the volume of the stream.

props.name: ended
props.description: Whether this resource has ended or not.

props.name: readable
props.description:
Whether this resource is readable. If the underlying resource is no longer readable, this will still return true
while there are silence padding frames left to play.

methods.name: read
methods.description:
Attempts to read an Opus packet from the audio resource. If a packet is available, the playbackDuration
is incremented.

classes.name: PlayerSubscription
classes.description:
Represents a subscription of a voice connection to an audio player, allowing
the audio player to play audio on the voice connection.

props.name: connection
props.description: The voice connection of this subscription.

props.name: player
props.description: The audio player of this subscription.

methods.name: unsubscribe
methods.description:
Unsubscribes the connection from the audio player, meaning that the
audio player cannot stream audio to it until a new subscription is made.

classes.name: SSRCMap
classes.description: Maps audio SSRCs to data of users in voice connections.

props.name: map
props.description: The underlying map.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the stored voice data about a user.

params.name: target
params.description: The target of the delete operation, either their audio SSRC or user id

methods.returnsDescription: The data that was deleted, if any

methods.name: get
methods.description: Gets the stored voice data of a user.

params.name: target
params.description: The target, either their user id or audio SSRC

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the map with new user data

classes.name: SpeakingMap
classes.description: Tracks the speaking states of users in a voice channel.

props.name: users
props.description: The currently speaking users, mapped to the milliseconds since UNIX epoch at which they started speaking.

props.name: DELAY
props.description: The delay after a packet is received from a user until they're marked as not speaking anymore.

classes.name: VoiceConnection
classes.description: A connection to the voice server of a Guild, can be used to play audio in voice channels.

params.name: joinConfig
params.description: The data required to establish the voice connection

params.name: options
params.description: The options used to create this voice connection

props.name: _state
props.description: The state of the voice connection.

props.name: debug
props.description: The debug logger function, if debugging is enabled.

props.name: joinConfig
props.description: A configuration storing all the data needed to reconnect to a Guild's voice server.

props.name: packets
props.description:
The two packets needed to successfully establish a voice connection. They are received
from the main Discord gateway after signalling to change the voice state.

props.name: receiver
props.description:
The receiver of this voice connection. You should join the voice channel with `selfDeaf` set
to false for this feature to work properly.

props.name: rejoinAttempts
props.description:
The number of consecutive rejoin attempts. Initially 0, and increments for each rejoin.
When a connection is successfully established, it resets to 0.

props.name: ping
props.description:
The latest ping (in milliseconds) for the WebSocket connection and audio playback for this voice
connection, if this data is available.

props.name: state
props.description: The current state of the voice connection.

methods.name: addServerPacket
methods.description:
Registers a `VOICE_SERVER_UPDATE` packet to the voice connection. This will cause it to reconnect using the
new data provided in the packet.

methods.name: addStatePacket
methods.description:
Registers a `VOICE_STATE_UPDATE` packet to the voice connection. Most importantly, it stores the id of the
channel that the client is connected to.

methods.name: configureNetworking
methods.description:
Attempts to configure a networking instance for this voice connection using the received packets.
Both packets are required, and any existing networking instance will be destroyed.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description:
Destroys the VoiceConnection, preventing it from connecting to voice again.
This method should be called when you no longer require the VoiceConnection to
prevent memory leaks.

params.name: adapterAvailable
params.description: Whether the adapter can be used

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Disconnects the VoiceConnection, allowing the possibility of rejoining later on.
methods.returnsDescription: `true` if the connection was successfully disconnected

methods.name: dispatchAudio
methods.description: Dispatches the previously prepared audio packet (if any)

methods.name: onNetworkingClose
methods.description:
Called when the networking instance for this connection closes. If the close code is 4014 (do not reconnect),
the voice connection will transition to the Disconnected state which will store the close code. You can
decide whether or not to reconnect when this occurs by listening for the state change and calling reconnect().

methods.name: onNetworkingDebug
methods.description: Propagates debug messages from the underlying network instance.

methods.name: onNetworkingError
methods.description: Propagates errors from the underlying network instance.

methods.name: onNetworkingStateChange
methods.description: Called when the state of the networking instance changes. This is used to derive the state of the voice connection.

methods.name: onSubscriptionRemoved
methods.description: Called when a subscription of this voice connection to an audio player is removed.

methods.name: playOpusPacket
methods.description: Prepares an audio packet and dispatches it immediately.

methods.name: prepareAudioPacket
methods.description: Prepares an audio packet for dispatch.

methods.name: rejoin
methods.description: Attempts to rejoin (better explanation soon:tm:)

methods.name: setSpeaking
methods.description:
Updates the speaking status of the voice connection. This is used when audio players are done playing audio,
and need to signal that the connection is no longer playing audio.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether or not to show as speaking

methods.name: subscribe
methods.description: Subscribes to an audio player, allowing the player to play audio on this voice connection.

params.name: player
params.description: The audio player to subscribe to

methods.name: updateReceiveBindings
methods.description:
Called when the networking state changes, and the new ws/udp packet/message handlers need to be rebound
to the new instances.

params.name: oldState
params.description: The old networking state, if there is one

classes.name: VoiceReceiver
classes.description:
Attaches to a VoiceConnection, allowing you to receive audio packets from other
users that are speaking.

props.name: connectionData
props.description: The connection data of the receiver.

props.name: speaking
props.description: The speaking map of the receiver.

props.name: ssrcMap
props.description: Maps SSRCs to Discord user ids.

props.name: subscriptions
props.description: The current audio subscriptions of this receiver.

props.name: voiceConnection
props.description: The attached connection of this receiver.

methods.name: onUdpMessage
methods.description: Called when the UDP socket of the attached connection receives a message.

methods.name: onWsPacket
methods.description: Called when a packet is received on the attached connection's WebSocket.

methods.name: parsePacket
methods.description: Parses an audio packet, decrypting it to yield an Opus packet.

params.name: nonce
params.description: The nonce buffer used by the connection for encryption

params.name: secretKey
params.description: The secret key used by the connection for encryption

methods.name: subscribe
methods.description: Creates a subscription for the given user id.
methods.returnsDescription: A readable stream of Opus packets received from the target

props.name: AutoPaused
props.description: When the player has paused itself. Only possible with the "pause" no subscriber behavior.

props.name: Buffering
props.description: When the player is waiting for an audio resource to become readable before transitioning to Playing.

props.name: Idle
props.description: When there is currently no resource for the player to be playing.

props.name: Paused
props.description: When the player has been manually paused.

props.name: Playing
props.description: When the player is actively playing an audio resource.

typedefs.name: EndBehaviorType
typedefs.description: The different behaviors an audio receive stream can have for deciding when to end.

props.name: AfterInactivity
props.description: The stream will end after a given time period of no audio packets.

props.name: AfterSilence
props.description: The stream will end after a given time period of silence/no audio packets.

props.name: Manual
props.description: The stream will only end when manually destroyed.

typedefs.name: NoSubscriberBehavior
typedefs.description:
Describes the behavior of the player when an audio packet is played but there are no available
voice connections to play to.

props.name: Pause
props.description: Pauses playing the stream until a voice connection becomes available.

props.name: Play
props.description: Continues to play through the resource regardless.

props.name: Stop
props.description: The player stops and enters the Idle state.

typedefs.name: StreamType
typedefs.description: The different types of stream that can exist within the pipeline.

typedefs.name: VoiceConnectionDisconnectReason
typedefs.description: The reasons a voice connection can be in the disconnected state.

props.name: AdapterUnavailable
props.description: When the adapter was unable to send a message requested by the VoiceConnection.

props.name: EndpointRemoved
props.description: When a VOICE_SERVER_UPDATE packet is received with a null endpoint, causing the connection to be severed.

props.name: Manual
props.description: When a manual disconnect was requested.

props.name: WebSocketClose
props.description: When the WebSocket connection has been closed.

typedefs.name: VoiceConnectionStatus
typedefs.description: The various status codes a voice connection can hold at any one time.

props.name: Connecting
props.description: The `VOICE_SERVER_UPDATE` and `VOICE_STATE_UPDATE` packets have been received, now attempting to establish a voice connection.

props.name: Destroyed
props.description: The voice connection has been destroyed and untracked, it cannot be reused.

props.name: Disconnected
props.description: The voice connection has either been severed or not established.

props.name: Ready
props.description: A voice connection has been established, and is ready to be used.

props.name: Signalling
props.description: Sending a packet to the main Discord gateway to indicate we want to change our voice state.

typedefs.name: AudioPlayerBufferingState
typedefs.description:
The state that an AudioPlayer is in when it is waiting for a resource to become readable. Once this
happens, the AudioPlayer will enter the Playing state. If the resource ends/errors before this, then
it will re-enter the Idle state.

props.name: resource
props.description: The resource that the AudioPlayer is waiting for

typedefs.name: AudioPlayerIdleState
typedefs.description: The state that an AudioPlayer is in when it has no resource to play. This is the starting state.

typedefs.name: AudioPlayerPausedState
typedefs.description:
The state that an AudioPlayer is in when it has either been explicitly paused by the user, or done
automatically by the AudioPlayer itself if there are no available subscribers.

props.name: playbackDuration
props.description:
The playback duration in milliseconds of the current audio resource. This includes filler silence packets
that have been played when the resource was buffering.

props.name: resource
props.description: The current resource of the audio player.

props.name: silencePacketsRemaining
props.description: How many silence packets still need to be played to avoid audio interpolation due to the stream suddenly pausing.

typedefs.name: AudioPlayerPlayingState
typedefs.description:
The state that an AudioPlayer is in when it is actively playing an AudioResource. When playback ends,
it will enter the Idle state.

props.name: missedFrames
props.description: The number of consecutive times that the audio resource has been unable to provide an Opus frame.

props.name: playbackDuration
props.description:
The playback duration in milliseconds of the current audio resource. This includes filler silence packets
that have been played when the resource was buffering.

props.name: resource
props.description: The resource that is being played.

props.name: signal
props.description: When provided the corresponding `AbortController` can be used to cancel an asynchronous action.

typedefs.name: CreateAudioPlayerOptions
typedefs.description: Options that can be passed when creating an audio player, used to specify its behavior.

typedefs.name: CreateAudioResourceOptions
typedefs.description: Options that are set when creating a new audio resource.

props.name: inlineVolume
props.description:
Whether or not inline volume should be enabled. If enabled, you will be able to change the volume
of the stream on-the-fly. However, this also increases the performance cost of playback. Defaults to `false`.

props.name: inputType
props.description: The type of the input stream. Defaults to `StreamType.Arbitrary`.

props.name: metadata
silencePaddingFrames
props.description:
The number of silence frames to append to the end of the resource's audio stream, to prevent interpolation glitches.
Defaults to 5.

typedefs.name: CreateVoiceConnectionOptions
typedefs.description: The options that can be given when creating a voice connection.

props.name: debug
props.description:
If true, debug messages will be enabled for the voice connection and its
related components. Defaults to false.

typedefs.name: DiscordGatewayAdapterImplementerMethods
typedefs.description: Methods that are provided by the implementer of a Discord gateway DiscordGatewayAdapter.

props.name: destroy
props.description:
This will be called by @discordjs/voice when the adapter can safely be destroyed as it will no
longer be used.

props.name: sendPayload
props.description: Implement this method such that the given payload is sent to the main Discord gateway connection.

typedefs.name: DiscordGatewayAdapterLibraryMethods
typedefs.description:
Methods that are provided by the @discordjs/voice library to implementations of
Discord gateway DiscordGatewayAdapters.

props.name: destroy
props.description: Call this when the adapter can no longer be used (e.g. due to a disconnect from the main gateway)

props.name: onVoiceServerUpdate
props.description: Call this when you receive a VOICE_SERVER_UPDATE payload that is relevant to the adapter.

props.name: onVoiceStateUpdate
props.description: Call this when you receive a VOICE_STATE_UPDATE payload that is relevant to the adapter.

typedefs.name: JoinVoiceChannelOptions
typedefs.description: The options that can be given when joining a voice channel.

props.name: channelId
props.description: The id of the Discord voice channel to join.

props.name: group
props.description: An optional group identifier for the voice connection.

props.name: guildId
props.description: The id of the guild that the voice channel belongs to.

props.name: selfDeaf
props.description: Whether to join the channel deafened (defaults to true)

props.name: selfMute
props.description: Whether to join the channel muted (defaults to true)

typedefs.name: ProbeInfo
typedefs.description: The resulting information after probing an audio stream

props.name: stream
props.description:
The readable audio stream to use. You should use this rather than the input stream, as the probing
function can sometimes read the input stream to its end and cause the stream to close.

props.name: type
props.description: The recommended stream type for this audio stream.

typedefs.name: SSRCMapEvents
typedefs.description: The events that an SSRCMap may emit.

typedefs.name: SpeakingMapEvents
typedefs.description: The events that a SpeakingMap can emit.

props.name: end
props.description: Emitted when a user stops speaking.

props.name: start
props.description: Emitted when a user starts speaking.

typedefs.name: VoiceConnectionConnectingState
typedefs.description:
The state that a VoiceConnection will be in when it is establishing a connection to a Discord
voice server.

typedefs.name: VoiceConnectionDestroyedState
typedefs.description:
The state that a VoiceConnection will be in when it has been permanently been destroyed by the
user and untracked by the library. It cannot be reconnected, instead, a new VoiceConnection
needs to be established.

typedefs.name: VoiceConnectionDisconnectedBaseState
typedefs.description:
The state that a VoiceConnection will be in when it is not connected to a Discord voice server nor is
it attempting to connect. You can manually attempt to reconnect using VoiceConnection#reconnect.

typedefs.name: VoiceConnectionDisconnectedOtherState
typedefs.description:
The state that a VoiceConnection will be in when it is not connected to a Discord voice server nor is
it attempting to connect. You can manually attempt to reconnect using VoiceConnection#reconnect.

typedefs.name: VoiceConnectionDisconnectedWebSocketState
typedefs.description:
The state that a VoiceConnection will be in when its WebSocket connection was closed.
You can manually attempt to reconnect using VoiceConnection#reconnect.

props.name: closeCode
props.description: The close code of the WebSocket connection to the Discord voice server.

typedefs.name: VoiceConnectionReadyState
typedefs.description:
The state that a VoiceConnection will be in when it has an active connection to a Discord
voice server.

typedefs.name: VoiceConnectionSignallingState
typedefs.description:
The state that a VoiceConnection will be in when it is waiting to receive a VOICE_SERVER_UPDATE and
VOICE_STATE_UPDATE packet from Discord, provided by the adapter.

typedefs.name: VoiceUserData
typedefs.description: The known data for a user in a Discord voice connection.

props.name: audioSSRC
props.description: The SSRC of the user's audio stream.

props.name: userId
props.description: The Discord user id of the user.

props.name: videoSSRC
props.description:
The SSRC of the user's video stream (if one exists)
Cannot be 0. If undefined, the user has no video stream.

typedefs.name: AudioPlayerState
typedefs.description: The various states that the player can be in.

typedefs.name: DiscordGatewayAdapterCreator
typedefs.description:
A function used to build adapters. It accepts a methods parameter that contains functions that
can be called by the implementer when new data is received on its gateway connection. In return,
the implementer will return some methods that the library can call - e.g. to send messages on
the gateway, or to signal that the adapter can be removed.

typedefs.name: VoiceConnectionDisconnectedState
typedefs.description:
The states that a VoiceConnection can be in when it is not connected to a Discord voice server nor is
it attempting to connect. You can manually attempt to connect using VoiceConnection#reconnect.

typedefs.name: VoiceConnectionState
typedefs.description: The various states that a voice connection can be in.
